title: The Cheeger constant as limit of Sobolev-type constants
abstract:
Let $Ω$ be a bounded, smooth domain of $\mathbb{R}^{N},$ $N\geq2.$ For $1<p<N$ and $0<q(p)<p^{\ast}:= rac{Np}{N-p}$ let \[ λ_{p,q(p)}:=\inf\left\{ \int_Ω\left\vert 
abla uight\vert ^{p}\mathrm{d}x:u\in W_{0}^{1,p}(Ω)	ext{ \ and \ }\int_{Ω}\left\vert uight\vert ^{q(p)}\mathrm{d}x=1ight\} . \] We prove that if $\lim_{pightarrow1^{+}}q(p)=1,$ then $\lim_{pightarrow 1^{+}}λ_{p,q(p)}=h(Ω)$, where $h(Ω)$ denotes the Cheeger constant of $Ω.$ Moreover, we study the behavior of the positive solutions $w_{p,q(p)}$ to the Lane-Emden equation $-\operatorname{div}(\left\vert 
abla wight\vert ^{p-2}
abla w)=\left\vert wight\vert ^{q-2}w,$ as $pightarrow1^{+}.$
